intro: Crossopetalum rostratum, commonly known as the rostrated crossopetalum, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in cultivation.
